info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 3 at 9:33AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...
White River near Centerton.
White River below Eagle Valley Power Plant.
.Significant and potentially major flooding is expected to develop along the White River due to several rounds of heavy rainfall through Sunday. The current forecast does not include the final round of heavy rainfall expected Saturday and Saturday night, so crests will likely be higher than those currently forecast and last longer.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...White River near Centerton.
* WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 15.3 feet, Extensive flooding of agricultural lands. Blue Bluff and Paragon Roads are impassable. Flood waters affect a few homes in Waverly.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 15.9 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this afternoon by around 345 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Monroe, IN; Morgan, IN; Owen, IN
